title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.2 - Permission conditioned upon compliance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.2 - Permission conditioned upon compliance

State Regulations

Any permission granted by the authority directly or
indirectly, expressly or by implication, to any person or persons, to enter
upon or use any terminal or part thereof, including but not limited to
passengers; spectators; sightseers; tenants, concessionaires and other persons
occupying space or doing business with the authority, its tenants and
concessionaires, and their officers and employees; permitees and; and all other
persons whatsoever whether or not within the foregoing categories, is
conditioned upon compliance with the authority rules and regulations, and entry
upon or into any terminal by any person shall be deemed to constitute an
agreement by such person to comply with said rules and regulations; provided, however, that provision may be made in a written lease that said rules and
regulations shall not apply to such leased area. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1150.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
